title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0001
text: What is the main purpose of a service registry in microservices architecture?

options.text: To store and manage information about available service instances

explanation: A service registry stores and manages information about available service instances and their network locations.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the function of a service registry?

options.text: It acts as a directory for service discovery

explanation: A service registry acts as a directory that allows services to discover each other dynamically.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a common service registry tool?
explanation: Consul is a popular service registry used for service discovery and health checking.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a key feature of a service registry?

options.text: Dynamic registration and deregistration of services

explanation: A service registry supports dynamic registration and deregistration of services as they start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a benefit of using a service registry?

options.text: Eliminates the need for load balancing

explanation: A service registry enables dynamic service discovery by maintaining an up-to-date list of available services.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a common protocol used by service registries?
explanation: Service registries often use HTTP or gRPC protocols for communication between services and the registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a common service registry used in cloud environments?
explanation: AWS Cloud Map is a managed service registry used in cloud-based microservices architectures.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a key responsibility of a service registry?

options.text: Maintaining a list of healthy service instances

explanation: A service registry maintains a list of healthy service instances for discovery and routing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of using a service registry for scalability?

options.text: Allows services to scale dynamically without manual configuration

explanation: A service registry allows services to scale dynamically by automatically updating available instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a challenge of using a service registry?
explanation: Maintaining registry availability and consistency is a key challenge in distributed environments.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for fault tolerance?

options.text: Removes failed instances from the registry automatically
Requires manual removal of failed instances

explanation: A service registry improves fault tolerance by automatically removing failed instances from its list.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a common health check mechanism used by service registries?
explanation: Service registries use heartbeats or periodic health checks to verify the health of registered services.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automates the registration and deregistration of services as they start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for maintainability?
explanation: A service registry centralizes service instance information, simplifying maintenance and updates.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for reliability?

options.text: Ensures clients connect only to healthy instances
Allows clients to connect to failed instances

explanation: A service registry ensures reliability by allowing clients to connect only to healthy service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for scalability?
explanation: A service registry supports dynamic scaling by automatically updating available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for performance?

options.text: Reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery

explanation: A service registry reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery and routing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a challenge of a service registry for availability?

options.text: Registry must be highly available to prevent service discovery failures
Registry can be offline without impact

explanation: The service registry must be highly available to ensure continuous service discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automatically updates service availability as instances start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes the outcome of using a service registry?

options.text: Services can discover and communicate dynamically

explanation: A service registry enables dynamic discovery and communication between services.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for fault tolerance?

options.text: Automatically removes failed instances from the registry
Requires manual removal of failed instances

explanation: A service registry improves fault tolerance by automatically removing failed instances from its list.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0022
text: Which of the following is a common open-source service registry?
explanation: Netflix Eureka is a widely used open-source service registry for microservices discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automates the registration and deregistration of services as they start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for scalability?
explanation: A service registry supports dynamic scaling by automatically updating available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0025
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for maintainability?
explanation: A service registry centralizes service instance information, simplifying maintenance and updates.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0026
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for reliability?

options.text: Ensures clients connect only to healthy instances
Allows clients to connect to failed instances

explanation: A service registry ensures reliability by allowing clients to connect only to healthy service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for performance?

options.text: Reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery

explanation: A service registry reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery and routing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a challenge of a service registry for availability?

options.text: Registry must be highly available to prevent service discovery failures
Registry can be offline without impact

explanation: The service registry must be highly available to ensure continuous service discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0029
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automatically updates service availability as instances start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0030
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for observability?

options.text: Provides visibility into registered services and their health
Hides service status from monitoring tools

explanation: A service registry provides visibility into registered services and their health status.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0031
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for fault isolation?

options.text: Removes failed instances without affecting others

explanation: A service registry isolates faults by removing failed instances without affecting others.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for transparency?

options.text: Provides a clear view of all active service instances

explanation: A service registry provides transparency by showing all active service instances and their status.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for continuous delivery?

options.text: Allows new services to register automatically after deployment

explanation: A service registry supports continuous delivery by allowing new services to register automatically after deployment.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for flexibility?

options.text: Supports both client-side and server-side discovery

explanation: A service registry supports both client-side and server-side discovery, providing flexibility.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automatically updates service health status through periodic checks.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0036
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for adaptability?

options.text: Adapts dynamically to service scaling and failures

explanation: A service registry adapts dynamically to service scaling and failures, ensuring up-to-date discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0037
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for alignment?

options.text: Aligns service discovery with infrastructure automation

explanation: A service registry aligns service discovery with infrastructure automation and orchestration tools.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0038
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for innovation?

options.text: Enables experimentation with new discovery mechanisms

explanation: A service registry enables experimentation with new discovery mechanisms and integration patterns.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0039
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for accountability?

options.text: Tracks service registration and health status

explanation: A service registry tracks service registration and health status, ensuring accountability.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0040
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for transparency?

options.text: Provides a clear view of all active service instances

explanation: A service registry provides transparency by showing all active service instances and their status.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0041
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for business continuity?

options.text: Ensures continuous service discovery during scaling or failures

explanation: A service registry ensures continuous service discovery during scaling or failures, supporting business continuity.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0042
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for modularity?

options.text: Separates discovery logic from business logic

explanation: A service registry separates discovery logic from business logic, improving modularity.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0043
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for continuous improvement?

options.text: Allows incremental updates to discovery mechanisms

explanation: A service registry allows incremental updates to discovery mechanisms, supporting continuous improvement.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0044
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for reliability?

options.text: Ensures clients connect only to healthy instances
Allows clients to connect to failed instances

explanation: A service registry ensures reliability by allowing clients to connect only to healthy service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0045
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for scalability?
explanation: A service registry supports dynamic scaling by automatically updating available service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0046
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for performance optimization?

options.text: Reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery

explanation: A service registry reduces latency by enabling direct service discovery and routing.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0047
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for automation?
explanation: A service registry automates the registration and deregistration of services as they start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0048
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for transparency?

options.text: Provides a clear view of all active service instances

explanation: A service registry provides transparency by showing all active service instances and their status.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0049
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a service registry for fault tolerance?

options.text: Automatically removes failed instances from the registry
Requires manual removal of failed instances

explanation: A service registry improves fault tolerance by automatically removing failed instances from its list.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryServiceRegistry - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a service registry?

options.text: To store and manage information about available service instances

explanation: A service registry stores and manages information about available service instances and their network locations.
